title:
The Second Law as a constraint and admitting the approximate nature of
  constitutive assumptions
abstract:
A scheme for treating the Second Law of thermodynamics as a constraint and
accounting for the approximate nature of constitutive assumptions in continuum
thermomechanics is discussed. An unconstrained, concave, variational principle
is designed for solving the resulting mathematical problem. Cases when the
Second Law becomes an over-constraint on the mechanical model, as well as when
it serves as a necessary constraint, are discussed.
